page.title: 07Ledger Farm,Fifield.
page.content: This{farm}is situated in the Fifield triangle and covers 80 acres.It dates back to the 17th Century. The present farmer has lived there for 20 years. No crops are grown; the land provides pasture for{beef cattle.}The Hereford calves are fattened up and sent to be slaughtered for meat. About 45,000 {chickens}are reared to produce eggs. These eggs are graded from size 1 to 5 according to weight. Some of them are sold in the farm's own shop and the rest go to a large, well-known egg marketing firm and other local shops. Fresh chicken, sausages and bacon are also sold in the{farm shop.}The farmer has two tractors, a hay-baler and two vans. He employs several people and they work from 8.00am until 5.00pm. Summer is the busiest time of year. There is a pond on the farm where a few{ducks}are kept.
